verses.verse: “Call out now if you so wish. Is there anyone who will reply? To which of the holy ones[b] will you turn?
Resentment slays the fool, and envy brings death to the simpleton.
I have seen a fool enjoy success for a time, but suddenly his house was cursed.
“His children are cut off from safety, slaughtered at the gate[c] without a defender.
The hungry devour their harvest, even that growing amid the thorns,[d] and the thirsty pant for their wealth.
For misery does not grow out of the earth, nor does trouble spring from the soil.
Rather, man breeds trouble for himself, as surely as sparks[e] fly upward.
“If I were you, I would appeal to God and present my case before him.
He performs deeds that are beyond understanding, and wonders that cannot be counted.
He provides rain for the earth and sends down water upon the fields.
He raises on high those who are lowly, and those who mourn he lifts to safety.
“He thwarts the schemes of the crafty so that they do not achieve any success.
He traps the cunning in their intrigues and throws their plans into disarray.
They encounter darkness in the daytime and grope their way at noon as if it were night.
But he saves the destitute from the sword and rescues them from the hand of the mighty.
Therefore, the poor once again have hope, and iniquity must shut its mouth.
“Blessed is the man whom God[h] reproves. Therefore, do not reject the discipline of the Almighty.
For even though he wounds, he also binds up; he smites, but his hands also heal.
He will deliver you from trouble six times, and on the seventh[i] no evil will touch you.
In time of famine he will rescue you from death, and in wartime from the thrust of the sword.
“You will be shielded from the scourge of the tongue, and you will not fear calamity when it looms.
You will laugh at destruction and famine and not be terrified by the beasts of the earth.
For you will have a covenant with the stones of the field and live in peace with wild animals.
You will know that your tent is secure, and your household will be intact when you inspect it.
“You will know that your descendants will be numerous, and your offspring like the grass of the earth.
You will go to the grave at a ripe old age, like sheaves gathered at the right time.
All this we have researched, and it is true. Heed it, and apply it to yourself.”
